result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Terrence R Wilkinson was found guilty of OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Not eligible for challenge or substance abuse.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License.  
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Copy of Minutes Form from Wood County Case #99CT383
Count 1
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Terrence R Wilkinson in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Terrence R Wilkinson in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Amendedon the record to a OWI 7th - ADA to file document later
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: OWI 7th: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty amended Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 2 is dismissed.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:***OWI 7th**PRISON**
3 yrs Incarceration and 3 yrs Extended Supervision
296 days credit
Not eligible for challenge or substance abuse.
Extended Supervision Conditions:
$300 Fine  + Costs/Surcharges =  25% from prison account
3 yrs months Revocation of License
3 yrs months Ignition Interlock Device
AODA/Order for DOT Alcohol Assessment/Driver's Safety Plan  .21%
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License  
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Plea hearing on October 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Terrence R Wilkinson in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Terrence R Wilkinson in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:35 p.m. Court calls the case. Atty. Cousins state the appearances.
Matter is before the court for a motion hearing on collateral attack of prior convictions.

Court questions if parties are reacdy to proceed.
Parties state they are ready.

Court recognizes the defendant from Court's time as District Attorney for Portage County and states prior knowledge on the record.

Exhibits #1 and #2 are mark for the State.
1:39 p.m. Clerk swears Defendant in.
Direct examination from Atty Mcfarland.
1:43 p.m. End Direct-examination

Atty Cousins makes statement to the Court.
Court is allowing defendant to testify and give supplemental hearing.

Court questions what bearing the Wood County Case testimony has on this case.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds the defendant was issued a Complaint towards the Wood County case and therefore the severity of the charges were known to him.
Court finds the defendant has failed to make a primafacia case based on the testimony and evidence presented.

Atty Mcfarland makes statements to the court.
Court clarifies the reasoning for Atty Mcfarland

Exhibits are withdrawn and not received into the case.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.
State's Brief in Reply to the Defendant's Motion Collateraly Attacking Prior Conviction
Affidavit of Terrence Wilkinson in Support of Defendant's Motion to Prohibit Consideration of Prior Conviction filed by Atty Erik McFarland
Notice of Motion and Defendant's Motion to Prohibit Consideration of Prior Conviction filed by Atty Erik McFarland
Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bond filed by Atty Erik McFarland

Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court, defendant Terrence R Wilkinson not in court, in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:01 pm. Court calls case.
This matter is before the Court on a motion for reduction of bond.
Atty Mcfarland argues in regards to motion.
Atty Cousins asks the Court to deny the motion and that the cash bond remain as it is.
Atty Mcfarland responds.
Court questions Atty Cousins in regards to the defendants previous convictions.

BY THE COURT:
Court believes that the cash bond set is appropriate.
Pre-trial conference at 03-28-2016 10:30 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Terrence R Wilkinson in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Terrence R Wilkinson in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.
